Package br.com.kirgh.app.controllers

Class AddressController

java.lang.Object
br.com.kirgh.app.controllers.AddressController
@RestController @RequestMapping(path="/api/v1/addresses", produces="application/json") public class AddressController extends Object
The AddressController class is a Java REST controller that handles POST requests to create a new address using an AddressDTO object.

  • Method Details

    • addressRegister

      @PostMapping(consumes="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> addressRegister(@RequestBody @Valid @Valid AddressDTO addressDTO)
      This function registers a new address by creating an Address object from the provided AddressDTO and returning a JSON response with the new address's ID and a success message.
      Parameters:
      addressDTO - AddressDTO is an object that contains the details of an address such as street, city, state, and zip code. It is annotated with @Valid to ensure that the input data is valid and meets the required constraints. The
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity object containing a JSON response with the resourceId and message of the newly created Address object. The HTTP status code of the response is set to 201 (CREATED).

    • getFilteredAddresses

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.data.domain.Page<Address>> getFilteredAddresses(org.springframework.data.domain.Pageable pageable, @RequestParam Map<String,String> filters)
      This Java function retrieves a paginated list of addresses based on filters and returns it as a JSON response.
      Parameters:
      pageable - The pageable parameter is used for pagination and sorting. It allows you to specify the page number, page size, and sorting criteria for the returned results.
      filters - A map of filters for searching addresses. The keys in the map represent the fields to filter on, and the values represent the filter values.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a ResponseEntity object with a JSON response body containing a Page<Address> object.

    • getAllAddressInfoById

      @GetMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Address> getAllAddressInfoById(@PathVariable UUID id)
      This function retrieves address information by ID and returns a JSON response with the address info.
      Parameters:
      id - The id parameter is a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that represents the unique identifier of the address.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a ResponseEntity object with the HTTP status code 200 (OK) and the body containing the address information in JSON format.

    • getAllAppliancesBoundAddress

      @GetMapping("/{id}/appliances") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AddressCompleteInfoDTO> getAllAppliancesBoundAddress(@PathVariable UUID id)
      The function getAllAppliancesBoundAddress retrieves address information by ID, including associated appliances, and returns a JSON response.
      Parameters:
      id - The id parameter is a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) that represents the unique identifier of an address.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a ResponseEntity object with the HTTP status code 200 (OK) and the body containing an AddressCompleteInfoDTO object.

    • updateAddressInfoById

      @PutMapping(path="/{id}", consumes="application/json") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Address> updateAddressInfoById(@PathVariable UUID id, @RequestBody @Valid @Valid AddressUpdateDTO addressUpdateDTO)
      This function updates an address and returns a JSON response with the new address information.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the address to be updated. It is a UUID (Universally Unique Identifier) type.
      addressUpdateDTO - The addressUpdateDTO is a DTO (Data Transfer Object) that contains the updated information for the address. It is annotated with @RequestBody to indicate that it will be received as a JSON object in the request body. The @Valid annotation is used to validate the content of the DTO according to the validation
      Returns:
      The method is returning a ResponseEntity<Address> object.

    • deleteAddressById

      @DeleteMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> deleteAddressById(@NonNull @PathVariable @NonNull UUID id)
      The function is a Java method for deleting an address by its ID and returning a JSON response with a success message.
      Parameters:
      id - The id parameter is the unique identifier of the address that needs to be deleted.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a ResponseEntity<String> object.
